background: Cynthia, a food scientist, faces a moral dilemma. Cynthia must decide whether to use a controversial ingredient in a new food product that will help solve world hunger. The ingredient is derived from an endangered species, but it is necessary to create the affordable, nutritious food.
evitability: If Cynthia does not use the controversial ingredient, there will be no depletion of the endangered species population.

background: Cynthia, a food scientist, faces a moral dilemma. Cynthia must decide whether to use a controversial ingredient in a new food product that will help solve world hunger. The ingredient is derived from an endangered species, but it is necessary to create the affordable, nutritious food.
evitability: If Cynthia prevents the use of the controversial ingredient, there will be no depletion of the endangered species population.
action: Cynthia does not prevent the use of the controversial ingredient.

background: Cynthia, a food scientist, faces a moral dilemma. Cynthia must decide whether to use a controversial ingredient in a new food product that will help solve world hunger. The ingredient is derived from an endangered species, but it is necessary to create the affordable, nutritious food.
evitability: Another food scientist would use the controversial ingredient, causing depletion of the endangered species population, no matter what Cynthia does.

background: Cynthia, a food scientist, faces a moral dilemma. Cynthia develops a new food product that can significantly extend the shelf life of perishable goods, reducing food waste. However, the product also causes allergic reactions in a small percentage of the population.
evitability: If Cynthia does not introduce the new food product, there will be no allergic reactions in a small percentage of the population.
action: Cynthia introduces the new food product
